featured.text: Near the “black ditch” of Penghu, battered by winds of up to 70 knots, the rear sail was torn into shreds.

His summer course included ancient history, which Papa felt our schools neglected, and navigation, in which we first had a formal examination in the dining room, part of which consisted of tying several knots in a given time limit.

definition.zh_def: 結，通常用於將兩根繩子或其他材料連接在一起的技術或形狀。
definition.en_def: A fastening made by tying a piece of string, rope, or something similar.
definition.example: He tied a knot to secure the two pieces of rope together.
